text: Wimboldsley is a village in Cheshire, England, 2 miles south of Middlewich. The population at the 2011 census was 153. In 2015, the civil parish amalgamated with Stanthorne to form Stanthorne and Wimboldsley. ==Geography== A small area in the west of the civil parish falls within the Weaver Valley Area of Special County Value.Cheshire County Council: Interactive Mapping: Areas of Special County Value: Weaver Valley (accessed 3 March 2009) Adjacent to this area, on the eastern bank of the River Weaver, is the Site of Special Scientific Interest of Wimboldsley Wood.Natural England: Wimboldsley Wood (accessed 16 April 2010)Natural England: Nature on the Map: Wimboldsley Wood SSSI (accessed 16 April 2010) ==See also== *Listed buildings in Wimboldsley *Lea Hall, Wimboldsley ==References== ==External links== Category:Villages in Cheshire Category:Former civil parishes in Cheshire Category:Cheshire West and Chester
title: Wimboldsley
